roleset.name: let go
roleset.note: RELEASE-V NOTES: Note that a record release is a distinctly different sense, but ittakes pretty much the same syntax. VN class free-80-1 (from release.01-v)
RELEASING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, release-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls free-80-1. (from releasing.01-n)
RELEASE-N NOTES: Roleset based on release.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from release.01-n)

example.name: active
example.text: NEC released a statement saying "We feel sorry for having caused trouble to society."
example.arg: a statement saying "We feel sorry for having caused trouble to society."

example.name: passive
example.text: [A 50-state study]-1 released *trace*-1 in September by Friends for Education, an Albuquerque NM school-research group....
example.arg: by Friends for Education, an Albuquerque NM school-research group

example.name: with source
example.text: Others-1 just released *trace*-1 from the majors...

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Unlikely to be sufficient price and rent rises each year to allow releasing of equity from the rental property , plus any fees incurred could make the transaction uneconomical .

example.name: Use goal for release into
example.text: the release of asbestos into the environment from a building hewas demolishing
example.arg: from a building he was demolishing

example.name: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: Her release from prison in March

example.name: Example with arg 0 and 1
example.text: Sony's long-awaited release of it's latest video game

example.name: Goal for release to as well
example.text: Her release from the hospital into police custody

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: the damper and the cable are releasable from the stud without tools by alignment of the keyhole features
example.arg: by alignment of the keyhole features
